lines.content: * The main class for the Flores chatbot application.
* Flores is a task management tool that allows users to track todos, deadlines, and events.
* It coordinates between the user interface, file storage, and command parsing logic.
* Initializes a new Flores application instance.
* Sets up the UI, loads existing tasks from the specified file path,
* @param filePath The local system path where task data is saved and loaded.
* Starts the main execution loop of the Flores application.
* Displays the welcome message and continuously processes user commands
Task e = new Event(eventData[0], eventData[1], eventData[2]);
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n " + tasks.get(markIdx));
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n " + tasks.get(unmarkIdx));
throw new FloresException("That task number does not exist.");
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
throw new FloresException("I DONT KNOW WHAT THAT MEANS BRUH");
* The entry point for starting the Flores application.
* Represents exceptions specific to the Flores application.
* This class is used to handle errors that occur during command parsing or task execution.
* Constructs a FloresException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The error message explaining the cause of the exception.
* Represents the valid command types that the Flores application can process.
* Command to add a Todo task.
* Command to add a Deadline task.
* Command to add an Event task.
* Command to mark a task as completed.
* Command to mark a task as incomplete.
* Command to remove a task from the list.
* Represents an unrecognized or invalid command.
// Extracts the description for a Todo task
public static String getTodoDescription(String input) throws FloresException {
throw new FloresException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
// Returns an array where [0] is description and [1] is the deadline date
public static String[] getDeadlineData(String input) throws FloresException {
throw new FloresException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new FloresException("A deadline must have a /by time.");
public static String[] getEventData(String input) throws FloresException {
throw new FloresException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new FloresException("An event must have /from and /to times.");
// Returns the index for Mark/Unmark/Delete commands
public static int getIndex(String input, String commandType) {
* Extracts the search keyword from the find command input.
* @param input The raw user input (e.g., "find book").
* @throws FloresException If the keyword is missing.
public static String getFindKeyword(String input) throws FloresException {
throw new FloresException("What am I supposed to find? Give me a keyword!");
* Handles the loading and saving of task data to a local file.
* This class is responsible for the persistence of the task list in the Flores application.
* Constructs a Storage object with a specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where task data is stored.
* Saves the provided list of tasks to the storage file.
* If the directory or file does not exist, they will be created.
* @param items The list of tasks to be written to the file.
* Loads the list of tasks from the storage file.
* Parses each line of the file and reconstructs the appropriate Task objects.
* Returns an empty list if the file does not exist.
* @return An ArrayList containing the tasks loaded from the file.
* Represents a task that needs to be completed by a specific date.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a due date.
* @param description The details of the task.
* @param by          The deadline date in yyyy-mm-dd format.
* Represents a task that occurs within a specific time range.
* Constructs an Event task with a description and a time duration.
* @param description The details of the event.
* @param from        The start date in yyyy-mm-dd format.
* @param to          The end date in yyyy-mm-dd format.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Represents a generic task in the Flores application.
* A task consists of a description and a status indicating whether it is completed.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* Initially, the task is marked as not done.
* @param description The details of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space " ".
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns true if task is completed, false otherwise.
* @return Whether task is completed or not.
* Returns a string representation of the task for UI display.
* @return A formatted string showing status and description.
* Returns a string representation of the task formatted for file storage.
* @return A formatted string suitable for saving to a text file.
* Filters the tasks to find descriptions containing the given keyword.
* @param keyword The string to search for within task descriptions.
* @return A new TaskList containing only the matching tasks.
* Represents a simple task without any date or time constraints.
* Constructs a Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The details of the todo item.
* Deals with interactions with the user.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user and reading user input.
* Initializes a new Ui object and sets up the scanner for user input.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Flores\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Reads the next line of input from the user.
* @return The raw string command entered by the user.
* Prints a horizontal separator line to the console.
* Displays an error message with a custom prefix.
* @param message The error details to be displayed.
* Displays a message indicating that the save file could not be loaded.
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! I couldn't load your tasks. Starting with a fresh list!");
* Prints a generic message to the user.
* @param message The text to be printed.
* Displays a confirmation message when a task is successfully added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param size The current number of tasks in the list after adding.
public void showAddedMessage(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays a confirmation message when a task is successfully removed.
* @param task The task that was removed.
* @param size The current number of tasks in the list after removal.
public void showRemovedMessage(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + size + " tasks in the list.");
* Iterates through and displays the entire list of tasks to the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks to be displayed.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
package flores; // Standard package name for the test source set
// Tests the visual output for the UI
assertEquals("[T][ ] read book", new Todo("read book").toString());
// Tests the data format used for saving to the hard disk
assertEquals("T | 0 | read book", new Todo("read book").toFileString());
